thread.title: Monarch cabin luggage restrictions

author: Lizzie Porter
title: Monarch cabin luggage restrictions
text: How many pieces of luggage can I bring in the cabin with me? Monarch passengers have two options. The first option is one piece of hand luggage no bigger than 56 x 40 x 25cm, plus one small duty-free bag from the airport. The second option is two separate pieces of hand baggage, as long as the combined size is no bigger than 56 x 40 x 25cm (for example, a small duffel bag and a laptop bag) plus a small duty free bag from the departure airport. Weight : Whichever option passengers choose, the total weight of hand luggage must be no more than 5kg on charter flights and 10kg on scheduled flights. Can I book a hold bag on a single leg, and travel hand-luggage only on the other? Yes. A typical 20kg hold bag costs £21.99 per leg. Am I allowed any items in addition to my one cabin bag ? Whichever hand baggage option passengers choose, they may carry one small bag of duty-free goods from the airport in the cabin, in addition to their cabin baggage brought from home. Related Articles Thomson hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Thomas Cook hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Virgin Atlantic hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 easyJet hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Anything else? Infants travelling on an adult’s lap do not have a hand baggage allowance. They can have a 10kg hold luggage allowance as long as one of the adults they are flying with purchases a hold bag. Pushchairs, prams and car seats are carried free of charge in the hold. See Monarch's full guidelines on cabin luggage .
